contents.text:
Student email: student@example.com
Study plan:
{"rationale":"I organized the 8-week plan around the AZ-305 exam’s scenario-heavy design workflow and topic dependencies. Weeks 1–2 refresh design prerequisites (core architecture + Cloud Adoption Framework + Well-Architected Framework) so later decisions (identity/governance/monitoring, data, HA/DR) are made using the same frameworks and trade-off language used in the exam. Weeks 3–4 cover the full “Design identity, governance, and monitor solutions” domain with a built-in review day before the weekly checkpoint. Weeks 5–6 cover “Design data storage solutions” in the typical architect order: non-relational vs relational choices first, then integration patterns that connect services. Week 7 focuses on HA/DR concepts and then the concrete Azure design module for backup/DR, which is best learned after understanding core architecture and data choices. Week 8 is consolidation: spaced repetition, targeted weak-area review, and two timed scenario sets to validate readiness. Pacing is set to ~6 hours/week with six 60-minute sessions, leaving one day off per week and including at least one reinforcement/review session weekly to reduce forgetting and improve recall under exam conditions.","planTitle":"AZ-305 (Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions) — 8-Week / 6 hrs-week Intermediate Plan","durationWeeks":8,"weeklyHours":6,"weeklyMilestones":[{"weekNumber":1,"objective":"Rebuild the AZ-305 design foundation: Azure core architectural components + start Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) concepts for scenario framing.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Describe the core architectural components of Azure — complete units on regions, region pairs, and geographies.","Create a 1-page notes sheet: region selection criteria (latency, compliance, resiliency)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Describe the core architectural components of Azure — complete units on subscriptions, management groups, resource groups.","Sketch a simple tenant → management group → subscription → RG hierarchy for a fictional org."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Describe the core architectural components of Azure — complete units on availability zones/sets and resiliency basics.","Write quick decision rules: when to use AZs vs region pairs vs availability sets."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Introduction to the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework — complete strategy + plan overview sections.","Capture key CAF terms: landing zones, management, governance, operating model."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Introduction to the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework — complete ready/adopt/govern sections.","Map CAF phases to 2–3 common scenario prompts (migration, governance, operating)."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review session: re-read your notes and create 15 flashcards (regions/AZs, resource org, CAF concepts).","Do a self-quiz: explain in 2–3 minutes how you’d choose a region and how you’d structure subscriptions."]}],"checkpoint":"Explain (without notes) a recommended resource organization (MG/subscriptions/RGs) for a 2-division company with dev/test/prod separation, and justify a region + resiliency approach (AZ vs region pair) based on compliance and uptime requirements."},{"weekNumber":2,"objective":"Use Well-Architected Framework (WAF) pillars to structure design tradeoffs; finalize prerequisites learning path content.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework — complete overview + reliability pillar.","Write a tradeoff template: requirement → constraints → options → decision + why."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: WAF — security pillar focus (identity, network, data protection themes at a high level).","List 10 common security design questions you expect in AZ-305 scenarios."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: WAF — cost optimization pillar focus.","Create a mini checklist: cost drivers (compute, storage, egress) and levers (reserved instances, scaling, tiers)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: WAF — operational excellence pillar focus (monitoring, deployment, automation).","Summarize how ops excellence influences monitoring design choices."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: WAF — performance efficiency pillar focus.","Write decision bullets for scaling patterns (vertical/horizontal, caching, CDN, partitioning)."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Consolidation: combine CAF + WAF into a single “scenario approach” page (how you’ll answer case studies).","Reinforcement: revisit any weak prerequisite units and update flashcards (+15)."]}],"checkpoint":"Given a scenario (global app, regulatory constraints, cost sensitivity), produce a 6–10 bullet design recommendation structured by WAF pillars (at least 1 decision per pillar)."},{"weekNumber":3,"objective":"Design governance: build consistent design patterns for management groups, subscriptions, Azure Policy, RBAC, and compliance.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design governance — complete units on management groups, subscriptions, and organizing resources.","Draft 2 subscription models: (A) by environment, (B) by business unit; note pros/cons."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design governance — complete units on Azure Policy concepts and initiative strategy.","Create examples: 5 policies you’d commonly enforce (regions, tags, SKUs, encryption, public IP)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design governance — complete units on resource consistency, naming/tagging, and governance at scale.","Build a simple naming + tagging standard (5 required tags) for your fictional org."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design governance — complete units on cost management/chargeback basics (as covered in module).","Write how governance interacts with cost controls (budgets, policy, role separation)."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Applied practice: write a 1-page governance design for a regulated company (MG layout, subscription layout, policy/initiative approach).","Identify 3 risks and mitigations (e.g., policy sprawl, RBAC misassignment, exception handling)."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review: 20-minute recall (no notes) of key governance constructs; then correct from notes.","Create/update flashcards (+15) focused on governance decisions and pitfalls."]}],"checkpoint":"Produce a governance recommendation that includes: management group hierarchy, subscription strategy, a starter set of policy initiatives, and a tagging/naming approach—each justified by a stated requirement."},{"weekNumber":4,"objective":"Design identity + monitoring: authentication/authorization choices and end-to-end logging/monitoring architecture.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design authentication and authorization solutions — complete units on identity fundamentals and Azure AD/Entra concepts as covered.","Make a decision list: when to use RBAC vs resource policies vs app-level auth."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design authentication and authorization solutions — complete units on hybrid identity patterns and access strategies.","Summarize tradeoffs: cloud-only vs hybrid; conditional access considerations at a high level."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design authentication and authorization solutions — complete units on privileged access and secure access patterns (as included).","Write a “least privilege” approach for 3 roles: ops, dev, security."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a solution to log and monitor Azure resources — complete units on Azure Monitor concepts, metrics vs logs.","Draw a simple monitoring architecture: sources → workspace → alerts → action groups."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a solution to log and monitor Azure resources — complete units on routing, analysis, and alerting design.","Create 5 example alert rules aligned to SLOs (latency, errors, capacity, availability, security signals)."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review + scenario drill: answer 6 short scenarios (3 identity, 3 monitoring) using your WAF tradeoff template.","Create/update flashcards (+20) for identity and monitoring design decisions."]}],"checkpoint":"Given a scenario with mixed workloads (IaaS+PaaS) and compliance needs, propose (1) an authN/authZ approach (roles, boundaries, privileged access), and (2) a monitoring/logging design (workspace strategy, alerts, retention) with explicit justifications."},{"weekNumber":5,"objective":"Design data storage for non-relational workloads: select appropriate services and design for protection, scalability, and performance.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for non-relational data — complete units on key non-relational options and selection factors (as covered).","Make a comparison table: workload requirement → preferred non-relational choice."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for non-relational data — complete units on durability, redundancy, and security considerations in the module.","Write decision bullets for replication/redundancy options and when they matter."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for non-relational data — complete remaining units and knowledge checks.","Extract 10 “if requirement then service/feature” rules for quick recall."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Applied practice: design storage for 3 scenarios: (1) IoT telemetry, (2) global user profile store, (3) static website + media.","For each: list availability, security, cost, and performance decisions."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Reinforcement: revisit any confusing sections; rewrite your comparison table to be exam-speed (quick scanning).","Create/update flashcards (+15) for non-relational design triggers."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Mixed review: 30 minutes identity/governance recap + 30 minutes non-relational recap (no notes then verify).","Create a 1-page “design defaults” sheet you can revise each week."]}],"checkpoint":"Choose and justify a non-relational data platform for a globally distributed, low-latency app with strict availability targets and variable traffic; include data protection/replication and access/security design notes."},{"weekNumber":6,"objective":"Design relational data storage + data integration patterns to move/transform data between services.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for relational data — complete units on relational choices and selection criteria in the module.","Create a decision table: requirement (HA, scale, ops burden, latency) → relational option."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for relational data — complete units on scaling/availability/protection as covered.","Write bullets: read scaling vs write scaling; backups vs replication vs failover."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a data storage solution for relational data — finish module + knowledge checks.","Summarize top 10 exam-style relational tradeoffs from the module."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design data integration — complete units on integration concepts and common patterns (batch vs streaming, ETL/ELT) as covered.","Draw 2 reference architectures: batch pipeline and streaming pipeline (high level)."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design data integration — complete remaining units + knowledge checks.","Write 6 scenario-based picks: given source/target/latency, choose an integration approach and justify."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Weekly review: 20-minute non-relational recap + 20-minute relational recap + 20-minute integration recap.","Update flashcards (+20) and tag weak areas for Week 8 review."]}],"checkpoint":"Given a scenario with transactional OLTP needs plus analytics/reporting needs, recommend (1) relational storage approach and (2) an integration pattern to feed analytics, including security and resiliency considerations."},{"weekNumber":7,"objective":"Design for business continuity: HA/DR strategy selection (RTO/RPO) and then specific backup/DR solution designs.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies — complete units on RTO/RPO and core HA/DR concepts.","Create an RTO/RPO cheat sheet with example targets (minutes/hours/days) and typical solution implications."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Describe high availability and disaster recovery strategies — complete remaining units and checks.","Write decision bullets for active-active vs active-passive; zonal vs regional vs multi-region."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a solution for backup and disaster recovery — complete units on backup design and recovery considerations.","List backup design requirements: retention, immutability/soft delete (if included), restore testing cadence."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Design a solution for backup and disaster recovery — complete units on DR design patterns and service selection (as covered).","Draft a DR runbook outline: failover criteria, steps, validation, failback."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario practice: design HA/DR for 3 workloads: (1) web app, (2) database, (3) file storage; specify RTO/RPO alignment.","Identify cost vs resiliency tradeoffs explicitly (WAF reliability + cost)."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Review: do a timed 30-minute mixed quiz you create from your flashcards; then 30-minute correction and notes cleanup.","Update “design defaults” sheet with HA/DR and backup principles."]}],"checkpoint":"For a stated RTO/RPO pair, propose a coherent HA/DR architecture (zones/regions, failover approach) and a backup strategy; explain what you would test and how often."},{"weekNumber":8,"objective":"Final consolidation and exam readiness: spaced review of all domains + timed scenario sets + patch weak spots.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Targeted review: revisit weakest module (based on flashcard tags) and re-do its knowledge checks.","Refresh your WAF tradeoff template and ensure it’s usable in <2 minutes per scenario."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Timed scenario set #1 (60 minutes): write answers to 8–12 short design prompts covering governance/identity/monitoring/data/DR.","Post-check: mark gaps and add 10 new flashcards from mistakes."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Focused patch session: governance + identity (pick 2–3 subareas you missed in Day 2).","Rewrite 5 ‘golden’ answers (ideal explanations) for common scenario patterns."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Timed scenario set #2 (60 minutes): focus on data storage + integration + HA/DR decisions.","Post-check: update cheat sheets (RTO/RPO, storage selection, monitoring architecture)."]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Full review: go through your 1-page notes for CAF, WAF, Governance, Identity, Monitoring, Data, HA/DR.","Do 25-minute closed-book recall, then 35-minute corrections and final flashcard pruning."]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Final readiness session: explain end-to-end reference architecture for a global app (identity, governance, monitoring, data, DR).","Create a ‘last-day’ sheet: top 20 decision triggers and the recommended direction."]}],"checkpoint":"Complete two 60-minute timed scenario sets and achieve: (1) consistent, requirement-driven justifications, (2) minimal second-guessing on service selection, and (3) a complete end-to-end architecture narrative you can deliver from memory in 10 minutes."}],"briefMessageToUser":"This plan keeps you at ~6 hours/week with one rest day and recurring review, while covering the AZ-305 design prerequisites first and then moving through governance/identity/monitoring, data storage/integration, and HA/DR. If you keep your cheat sheets and flashcards updated weekly and complete the two timed scenario sets in Week 8, you’ll be well-positioned for AZ-305’s scenario-based questions."}

Produce JSON only matching the provided schema

{"rationale":"This engagement plan aligns reminders to the student’s 8-week AZ-305 pathway, reinforcing the intended dependency order (core architecture → CAF/WAF → governance/identity/monitoring → data → HA/DR → final scenario readiness). It emphasizes consistent recall (flashcards, closed-book drills) and scenario-style output (tradeoff templates, timed sets) to match the exam’s design-justification format while maintaining the planned ~6 hrs/week cadence.","recipientEmail":"student@example.com","reminders":[{"schedule":"2026-02-24T09:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 1 — Azure regions & geographies (AZ-305 foundations)","body":"Start Week 1 strong: complete the Azure core architecture units on regions/region pairs/geographies, then capture a 1-page region selection criteria sheet (latency, compliance, resiliency).","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-25T09:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 2 — Subscriptions, MGs, and RGs","body":"Complete the subscriptions/management groups/resource groups units, then sketch a tenant→MG→subscription→RG hierarchy for a fictional org to lock in exam-style resource organization reasoning.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-26T09:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 3 — Availability zones/sets & resiliency basics","body":"Finish the availability zones/sets units and write quick decision rules (AZs vs region pairs vs availability sets) so you can answer resiliency prompts without hesitation.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-core-architectural-components-of-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-27T09:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 4 — Cloud Adoption Framework (strategy + plan)","body":"Complete CAF strategy + plan overview and capture key terms (landing zones, management, governance, operating model) to improve your scenario framing vocabulary.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/intro-to-cloud-adoption-framework/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-28T09:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 5 — CAF (ready/adopt/govern)","body":"Finish CAF ready/adopt/govern sections and map each phase to 2–3 common scenario prompts (migration, governance, operating) to speed up case-study structure.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/intro-to-cloud-adoption-framework/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-01T09:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 6 — Review + flashcards + self-quiz","body":"Re-read your notes, build 15 flashcards, and do a 2–3 minute verbal self-quiz on region choice and subscription structure to cement recall under pressure.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/microsoft-azure-fundamentals-describe-azure-architecture-services/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-03T09:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 1 — Well-Architected Framework (overview + reliability)","body":"Complete WAF overview + reliability pillar and draft your tradeoff template (requirements→constraints→options→decision) so every answer stays structured and defensible.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/intro-to-azure-well-architected-framework/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-04T09:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 2 — WAF security pillar","body":"Focus on the WAF security pillar and list 10 security design questions you expect in AZ-305 scenarios to sharpen your “what should I ask?” instincts.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/azure-well-architected-framework-security/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-05T09:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 3 — WAF cost optimization pillar","body":"Complete the cost optimization pillar and build your mini checklist (drivers + levers) so you can justify cost tradeoffs quickly in design prompts.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/azure-well-architected-framework-cost-optimization/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-06T09:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 4 — WAF operational excellence pillar","body":"Cover operational excellence and summarize how deployment/automation/monitoring considerations change architecture choices—this shows up constantly in scenarios.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/azure-well-architected-framework-operational-excellence/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-07T09:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 5 — WAF performance efficiency pillar","body":"Finish performance efficiency and write concise scaling decision bullets (vertical/horizontal, caching, CDN, partitioning) for fast service-selection reasoning.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/azure-well-architected-framework-performance-efficiency/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-08T09:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 6 — CAF + WAF scenario approach page","body":"Combine CAF + WAF into a single scenario-approach page and add 15 flashcards; you’re building the exact “answering muscle” AZ-305 rewards.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/overview/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-10T09:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 1 — Design governance (MGs/subscriptions/org)","body":"Complete governance units on management groups/subscriptions/resource organization, then draft two subscription models with pros/cons to improve justification speed.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-governance/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-11T09:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 2 — Azure Policy & initiatives strategy","body":"Study Azure Policy concepts and initiative strategy, then write 5 common policies you’d enforce (regions/tags/SKUs/encryption/public IP) to build a starter baseline.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-governance/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-12T09:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 3 — Naming/tagging & governance at scale","body":"Finish the resource consistency/naming/tagging units and build your required-tags standard—this is easy exam points when you can articulate it cleanly.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-governance/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-13T09:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 4 — Governance + cost management/chargeback basics","body":"Complete the cost management aspects in the governance module and write how policy/budgets/role separation interact so your answers reflect real-world controls.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-governance/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-14T09:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 5 — Applied governance design (1-page)","body":"Draft your 1-page governance design for a regulated company and call out 3 risks + mitigations—this turns concepts into exam-ready narratives.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-adoption-framework/govern/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-15T09:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 6 — Governance recall + flashcards","body":"Do a 20-minute closed-book governance recall, correct from notes, and add 15 flashcards focused on decisions/pitfalls to harden retention.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-governance/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-17T09:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 1 — Design authN/authZ (fundamentals)","body":"Complete identity fundamentals/Azure AD (Microsoft Entra) concepts and write your decision list (RBAC vs policy vs app auth) to clarify boundaries.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-authentication-authorization-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-18T09:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 2 — Hybrid identity patterns & access strategies","body":"Cover hybrid identity patterns and summarize cloud-only vs hybrid tradeoffs plus conditional access considerations so you can justify access models in scenarios.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-authentication-authorization-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-19T09:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 3 — Privileged access & least privilege","body":"Finish privileged access/secure access patterns and write least-privilege approaches for ops/dev/security roles to make your recommendations concrete.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-authentication-authorization-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-20T09:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 4 — Azure Monitor basics (metrics vs logs)","body":"Complete the Azure Monitor concepts units and draw your monitoring architecture (sources→workspace→alerts→action groups) to lock in end-to-end flow.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-solution-to-log-monitor-azure-resources/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-21T09:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 5 — Monitoring routing/analysis/alerting design","body":"Finish routing/analysis/alerting design and create 5 SLO-aligned alert rules so your monitoring answers are measurable and actionable.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-solution-to-log-monitor-azure-resources/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-22T09:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 6 — Identity + monitoring scenario drill","body":"Run 6 short scenarios using your WAF tradeoff template, then add 20 flashcards from gaps—this is where speed and clarity start compounding.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-24T09:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 1 — Non-relational storage options & selection","body":"Complete the non-relational storage module units on options/selection factors, then build your comparison table (requirement→service) for quick exam scanning.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-non-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-25T09:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 2 — Durability, redundancy, security (non-relational)","body":"Cover durability/redundancy/security considerations and write decision bullets for replication choices so you can tie protection to requirements cleanly.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-non-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-26T09:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 3 — Finish module + knowledge checks (non-relational)","body":"Finish remaining units and knowledge checks, then extract 10 “if requirement → service/feature” rules to speed up service selection under time limits.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-non-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-27T09:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 4 — Applied storage design (3 scenarios)","body":"Design storage for IoT telemetry, global profile store, and static site/media; explicitly state availability/security/cost/performance decisions for each.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/guide/technology-choices/data-store-overview"},{"schedule":"2026-03-28T09:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 5 — Reinforcement + flashcards (non-relational)","body":"Revisit confusing sections and rewrite your comparison table into an exam-speed version, then add 15 flashcards for non-relational design triggers.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-non-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-29T09:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 6 — Mixed review + design defaults sheet","body":"Do a no-notes recap (identity/governance + non-relational), then produce a 1-page “design defaults” sheet you’ll refine weekly for fast final review.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-31T09:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 1 — Relational choices & selection criteria","body":"Complete the relational storage module units on service choices/criteria, then build a decision table (HA/scale/ops/latency→option) to guide scenarios.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-01T09:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 2 — Relational scaling/availability/protection","body":"Cover scaling/availability/protection and write bullets for read vs write scaling and backups vs replication vs failover so your justifications stay precise.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-02T09:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 3 — Finish relational module + knowledge checks","body":"Finish the module and summarize your top 10 relational tradeoffs—these become quick anchors when questions get scenario-heavy.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-storage-solution-for-relational-data/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-03T09:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 4 — Data integration patterns (batch vs streaming, ETL/ELT)","body":"Complete integration concepts and draw one batch and one streaming reference architecture to make pattern selection automatic in prompts.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-integration/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-04T09:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 5 — Finish integration module + knowledge checks","body":"Finish integration units and write 6 scenario-based picks (source/target/latency→approach) so you practice the exact decision workflow AZ-305 expects.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-data-integration/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-05T09:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 6 — Weekly recap + flashcards (data)","body":"Run a 20/20/20 recap (non-relational/relational/integration), then add 20 flashcards and tag weak areas for Week 8 targeted review.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-data-storage-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-07T09:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 1 — HA/DR concepts + RTO/RPO","body":"Complete HA/DR strategy units on RTO/RPO and build your cheat sheet with example targets so you can align architectures to recovery requirements fast.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-08T09:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 2 — HA/DR strategy choices (active-active, zonal/regional)","body":"Finish the HA/DR module and write decision bullets for active-active vs active-passive and zonal vs regional vs multi-region to clarify tradeoffs.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-high-availability-disaster-recovery-strategies/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-09T09:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 3 — Backup design (requirements & recovery)","body":"Start the backup/DR design module and list your backup requirements (retention, protection, restore testing cadence) so your answers are operationally realistic.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-solution-for-backup-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-10T09:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 4 — DR design patterns + runbook outline","body":"Complete DR design patterns/service selection units and draft a DR runbook outline (failover criteria/steps/validation/failback) to turn theory into execution.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-solution-for-backup-disaster-recovery/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-11T09:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 5 — HA/DR scenario practice (3 workloads)","body":"Design HA/DR for a web app, database, and file storage with explicit RTO/RPO alignment, then call out cost vs resiliency tradeoffs using WAF language.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/framework/resiliency/overview"},{"schedule":"2026-04-12T09:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 6 — Timed flashcard quiz + notes cleanup","body":"Run a 30-minute timed quiz from your flashcards, then spend 30 minutes correcting and updating your design-defaults sheet with HA/DR + backup principles.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-14T09:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 1 — Targeted weakest-area review + knowledge checks","body":"Hit your weakest tagged module and re-do its knowledge checks, then refresh your WAF tradeoff template so it’s usable in under 2 minutes per scenario.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-microsoft-azure-infrastructure-solutions/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-15T09:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 2 — Timed scenario set #1 (60 minutes)","body":"Do timed scenario set #1 (8–12 prompts across domains), then add 10 flashcards from mistakes—treat every miss as a reusable rule.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/practice/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-16T09:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 3 — Patch session (governance + identity) + golden answers","body":"Patch the governance/identity subareas you missed and rewrite 5 “golden answers” so your explanations stay consistent, requirement-led, and confident.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/design-governance/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-17T09:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 4 — Timed scenario set #2 (data + integration + HA/DR)","body":"Do timed scenario set #2 focused on data/integration/HA-DR, then update your cheat sheets (RTO/RPO, storage selection, monitoring architecture) based on gaps.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/practice/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-18T09:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 5 — Full closed-book recall + corrections","body":"Run through your 1-page notes across all domains, do 25 minutes closed-book recall, then correct and prune flashcards so only high-value triggers remain.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-305/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-19T09:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 6 — Final readiness: end-to-end global app architecture","body":"Explain an end-to-end reference architecture (identity, governance, monitoring, data, DR) from memory, then create your last-day top-20 decision triggers sheet.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/example-scenario/" }],"motivationMessages":[{"schedule":"2026-02-24T08:45:00","body":"Today’s goal is momentum: finish the first architecture units and capture simple decision criteria—clarity beats volume, and you’ll build from it all plan long."},{"schedule":"2026-03-10T08:45:00","body":"Governance week is where “architect thinking” starts to show—focus on justifying choices, not memorizing features."},{"schedule":"2026-03-24T08:45:00","body":"Data service selection gets easier when you write rules (“if requirement, then choice”); keep them short and scenario-ready."},{"schedule":"2026-04-07T08:45:00","body":"For HA/DR, always anchor on RTO/RPO first; once those are clear, the architecture decisions become straightforward and defensible."},{"schedule":"2026-04-15T08:45:00","body":"Timed scenarios are practice for calm execution—aim for requirement-driven bullets, then convert every mistake into a flashcard you won’t miss again."}],"briefMessageToUser":"Your reminders are scheduled to match each 60-minute session across all 8 weeks, with direct Microsoft Learn links and a consistent focus on scenario-style justification. Stick to the cadence and keep your flashcards/cheat sheets updated—Week 8 will feel much easier if Weeks 3–7 stay consistent."}
